page.title: 07Schools
page.content: There are four schools in this area: they are Banff Primary, Macduff Primary, Banff Academy and The Ramsay School. Banff Academy serves a catchment area of about 180 square kilometres. It provides senior education for children aged 11-18.It takes in pupils from 9 different schools.As Banff Academy is such a big school with a roll of 1066 pupils, it needs 90 teachers to cover all subjects.Banff and Macduff are the two biggest primary schools in the catchment area - together they have a roll of 748 pupils and 28 teachers. The Ramsay School, situated next door to Banff Primary, caters for pupils with special educational needs. It has at present a roll of 37 pupils with a staff of 7.A fleet of buses operates daily to transport pupils to their various schools.
